description: Web-adapted Ten Rules for safety-critical JavaScript development

rule1.description: Restrict code to simple, predictable control flow patterns
rule1.webAdaptation: Focus on async/await patterns and DOM event handling
restrictions: No deeply nested callbacks (callback hell)
Prefer async/await over complex Promise chains
No recursive DOM traversal beyond 10 levels
Limit conditional complexity (max 3 nested if statements)

rule2.description: All loops must have fixed upper bounds to prevent browser freezing
rule2.webAdaptation: Prevent infinite loops that could freeze the browser or cause performance issues

animationFrameLoops.description: Animation loops must complete within 16ms for 60fps

domTraversal.description: Limit DOM queries to prevent performance degradation

dataProcessing.description: Process large datasets in batches with requestIdleCallback

rule3.description: Control memory allocation patterns in web applications
rule3.webAdaptation: Minimize DOM manipulation and object creation during runtime
restrictions: Minimize DOM element creation during animation loops
Pre-allocate Three.js geometries and materials at initialization
Use object pooling for frequently created/destroyed objects
Clean up event listeners and observers to prevent memory leaks

rule4.description: Keep functions concise for maintainability and testing
rule4.webAdaptation: Especially important for event handlers and animation callbacks

eventHandlers.description: Event handlers should be lightweight and delegate to other functions

componentMethods.description: Component methods should focus on single responsibility

rule5.description: Ensure robust validation throughout the application
rule5.webAdaptation: Focus on input validation, type checking, and error boundaries

userInputs.description: All user inputs must be validated and sanitized

apiResponses.description: API responses must be type-checked and have error handling

rule6.description: Minimize data scope and prefer modular patterns
rule6.webAdaptation: Use ES6 modules, avoid global variables, prefer encapsulation
restrictions: No global variables except constants and configuration
Use ES6 modules for code organization
Prefer class private fields or closures
Minimize window object pollution

rule7.description: Implement graceful error handling and recovery mechanisms
rule7.webAdaptation: Handle network failures, DOM errors, and user experience degradation gracefully

networkErrors.description: Network failures should have retry logic and user feedback

renderingErrors.description: Rendering errors should show fallback UI

userExperience.description: Long operations should show progress to users

rule8.description: Validate all function parameters, return values, and external data
rule8.webAdaptation: Essential for DOM manipulation, API calls, and user interactions

domQueries.description: Always check if DOM elements exist before manipulation

apiCalls.description: Validate API responses and handle network errors

userInputs.description: Validate user inputs for type and boundary conditions

rule9.description: Keep build processes and bundler configurations simple
rule9.webAdaptation: Avoid complex build tool configurations that obscure code behavior
restrictions: Limit webpack loader chaining to 3 levels
Avoid dynamic imports in performance-critical paths
Keep polyfill usage minimal and documented
Use tree-shaking friendly code patterns

bundling.description: Keep bundles small for better performance

polyfills.description: Document polyfill usage and target modern browsers

rule10.description: Handle object references and DOM elements safely
rule10.webAdaptation: Prevent null reference errors and memory leaks in web applications
restrictions: No direct property access without existence check
Use optional chaining (?.) for nested object access
Avoid circular references in complex data structures
Clean up object references in event handlers

domReferences.description: Cache DOM references and clean up event listeners

objectChaining.description: Use optional chaining for safe property access

rule11.description: Maintain zero warnings in linting and build processes
rule11.webAdaptation: Use ESLint, TypeScript, and browser dev tools to catch issues early

eslint.description: Use strict ESLint configuration with project-specific rules

typescript.description: Use TypeScript strict mode for better type safety

browser.description: Address all browser console warnings and deprecations
